Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (7 ll., one of which washed out) and names of 16 witnesses on verso (washed out). Scribe Phatres son of Herieus. Sale of half a house, the names of the parties are lost (one is said to be a "man of Aswan"). Date restored, year 5 or six of Ptolemy VI.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.106-7, pl.95-6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (48652) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/48652)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Window verso Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
